newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London edge up in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London edge up in thin trade.

text.p: Japanese stocks trading in London edged higher in quiet trade on Frday as the strength of the dollar sparked some buying-interest in blue-chips, dealers said.
The Nikkei 50 index was at 1,402.62 at 1525 GMT, 4.98 points or 0.36 percent above Thursday's London close. The Nikkei 225 in Tokyo ended 23.16 points or 0.13 percent higher at 17,923.64.

"There's been no real volume but there has been a bit of interest in some of the blue chips because of the dollar," one dealer said. "Futures are trading above cash, probably helped by the U.S. data today."
Dealers said Hitachi Ltd, Fujitsu Ltd and NEC Corp had seen modest buying.
